messages.name: inject
messages.description: Injects an artificial event on the given object and returns the corresponding ID in the form of a token, which can be used as a point of reference for database events. For example, to check whether an object has reached the right state before attempting an operation, one can inject an artificial event on the object and wait until the token returned by consecutive event.from calls is lexicographically greater than the one returned by event.inject.
result: the event ID in the form of a token

params.name: ref
params.doc: A reference to the object that will be changed.

transitions.description: Injects an artificial event on the given object and returns the corresponding ID in the form of a token, which can be used as a point of reference for database events. For example, to check whether an object has reached the right state before attempting an operation, one can inject an artificial event on the object and wait until the token returned by consecutive event.from calls is lexicographically greater than the one returned by event.inject.

messages.name: get_current_id
messages.description: Return the ID of the next event to be generated by the system

transitions.description: Return the ID of the next event to be generated by the system

messages.name: from
messages.description: Blocking call which returns a new token and a (possibly empty) batch of events. The returned token can be used in subsequent calls to this function.
result: a structure consisting of a token ('token'), a map of valid references per object type ('valid_ref_counts'), and a set of event records ('events').

params.name: classes
params.doc: register for events for the indicated classes

params.name: token
params.doc: A token representing the point from which to generate database events. The empty string represents the beginning.

params.name: timeout
params.doc: Return after this many seconds if no events match

errors.name: SESSION_NOT_REGISTERED
errors.doc: This session is not registered to receive events. You must call event.register before event.next. The session handle you are using is echoed.

errors.name: EVENTS_LOST
errors.doc: Some events have been lost from the queue and cannot be retrieved.

transitions.description: Blocking call which returns a new token and a (possibly empty) batch of events. The returned token can be used in subsequent calls to this function.

messages.name: next
messages.description: Blocking call which returns a (possibly empty) batch of events. This method is only recommended for legacy use. New development should use event.from which supercedes this method.

errors.name: SESSION_NOT_REGISTERED
errors.doc: This session is not registered to receive events. You must call event.register before event.next. The session handle you are using is echoed.

errors.name: EVENTS_LOST
errors.doc: Some events have been lost from the queue and cannot be retrieved.

transitions.description: Blocking call which returns a (possibly empty) batch of events. This method is only recommended for legacy use. New development should use event.from which supercedes this method.

messages.name: unregister
messages.description: Removes this session's registration with the event system for a set of given classes. This method is only recommended for legacy use in conjunction with event.next.

messages.description: Clones the specified VM, making a new VM. Clone automatically exploits the capabilities of the underlying storage repository in which the VM's disk images are stored (e.g. Copy on Write).   This function can only be called when the VM is in the Halted State.
result: The reference of the newly created VM.

params.name: new_name
params.doc: The name of the cloned VM

errors.name: VM_BAD_POWER_STATE
errors.doc: You attempted an operation on a VM that was not in an appropriate power state at the time; for example, you attempted to start a VM that was already running. The parameters returned are the VM's handle, and the expected and actual VM state at the time of the call.

errors.name: SR_FULL
errors.doc: The SR is full. Requested new size exceeds the maximum size

errors.name: OPERATION_NOT_ALLOWED
errors.doc: You attempted an operation that was not allowed.

errors.name: LICENCE_RESTRICTION
errors.doc: This operation is not allowed because your license lacks a needed feature. Please contact your support representative.

messages.name: create
messages.description:
NOT RECOMMENDED! VM.clone or VM.copy (or VM.import) is a better choice in almost all situations. The standard way to obtain a new VM is to call VM.clone on a template VM, then call VM.provision on the new clone. Caution: if VM.create is used and then the new VM is attached to a virtual disc that has an operating system already installed, then there is no guarantee that the operating system will boot and run. Any software that calls VM.create on a future version of this API may fail or give unexpected results. For example this could happen if an additional parameter were added to VM.create. VM.create is intended only for use in the automatic creation of the system VM templates. It creates a new VM instance, and returns its handle.
The constructor args are: name_label, name_description, power_state, user_version*, is_a_template*, suspend_VDI, affinity*, memory_target, memory_static_max*, memory_dynamic_max*, memory_dynamic_min*, memory_static_min*, VCPUs_params*, VCPUs_max*, VCPUs_at_startup*, actions_after_softreboot, actions_after_shutdown*, actions_after_reboot*, actions_after_crash*, PV_bootloader*, PV_kernel*, PV_ramdisk*, PV_args*, PV_bootloader_args*, PV_legacy_args*, HVM_boot_policy*, HVM_boot_params*, HVM_shadow_multiplier, platform*, PCI_bus*, other_config*, last_boot_CPU_flags, last_booted_record, recommendations*, xenstore_data, ha_always_run, ha_restart_priority, tags, blocked_operations, protection_policy, is_snapshot_from_vmpp, snapshot_schedule, is_vmss_snapshot, appliance, start_delay, shutdown_delay, order, suspend_SR, version, generation_id, hardware_platform_version, has_vendor_device, reference_label, domain_type, NVRAM (* = non-optional).
result: reference to the newly created object

transitions.description: possibility to create a VM in suspended mode with a suspend_VDI set

messages.description: Get a reference to the VM instance with the specified UUID.

values.name: Halted
values.doc: VM is offline and not using any resources

values.name: Paused
values.doc: All resources have been allocated but the VM itself is paused and its vCPUs are not running

values.name: Running
values.doc: Running

values.name: Suspended
values.doc: VM state has been saved to disk and it is nolonger running. Note that disks remain in-use while the VM is suspended.

values.name: reboot_host
values.doc: Indicates the updated host should reboot as soon as possible

values.name: reboot_host_on_livepatch_failure
values.doc: Indicates the updated host should reboot as soon as possible since one or more livepatch(es) failed to be applied.

values.name: reboot_host_on_kernel_livepatch_failure
values.doc: Indicates the updated host should reboot as soon as possible since one or more kernel livepatch(es) failed to be applied.

fields.description: True if the guest is sending heartbeat messages via the guest agent

transitions.description: True if the guest is sending heartbeat messages via the guest agent

fields.name: can_use_hotplug_vbd
fields.description: The guest's statement of whether it supports VBD hotplug, i.e. whether it is capable of responding immediately to instantiation of a new VBD by bringing online a new PV block device. If the guest states that it is not capable, then the VBD plug and unplug operations will not be allowed while the guest is running.

transitions.description: To be used where relevant and available instead of checking PV driver version.

fields.name: can_use_hotplug_vif
fields.description: The guest's statement of whether it supports VIF hotplug, i.e. whether it is capable of responding immediately to instantiation of a new VIF by bringing online a new PV network device. If the guest states that it is not capable, then the VIF plug and unplug operations will not be allowed while the guest is running.

transitions.description: To be used where relevant and available instead of checking PV driver version.

fields.name: PV_drivers_detected
fields.description: At least one of the guest's devices has successfully connected to the backend.

values.name: provision
values.doc: Indicates this host is able to provision another VM

values.name: evacuate
values.doc: Indicates this host is evacuating

values.name: shutdown
values.doc: Indicates this host is in the process of shutting itself down

values.name: reboot
values.doc: Indicates this host is in the process of rebooting

values.name: power_on
values.doc: Indicates this host is in the process of being powered on

values.name: vm_start
values.doc: This host is starting a VM

values.name: vm_resume
values.doc: This host is resuming a VM

values.name: vm_migrate
values.doc: This host is the migration target of a VM

values.name: apply_updates
values.doc: Indicates this host is being updated

values.name: enable
values.doc: Indicates this host is in the process of enabling

values.name: yes
values.doc: The host is up to date with the latest updates synced from remote CDN

values.name: no
values.doc: The host is outdated with the latest updates synced from remote CDN

values.name: unknown
values.doc: If the host is up to date with the latest updates synced from remote CDN is unknown

values.name: reboot_host
values.doc: Indicates the updated host should reboot as soon as possible

values.name: reboot_host_on_livepatch_failure
values.doc: Indicates the updated host should reboot as soon as possible since one or more livepatch(es) failed to be applied.

values.name: reboot_host_on_kernel_livepatch_failure
values.doc: Indicates the updated host should reboot as soon as possible since one or more kernel livepatch(es) failed to be applied.

values.name: reboot_host_on_xen_livepatch_failure
values.doc: Indicates the updated host should reboot as soon as possible since one or more xen livepatch(es) failed to be applied.

values.name: restart_toolstack
values.doc: Indicates the Toolstack running on the updated host should restart as soon as possible

values.name: restart_device_model
values.doc: Indicates the device model of a running VM should restart as soon as possible

values.name: restart_vm
values.doc: Indicates the VM should restart as soon as possible

values.name: enabled
values.doc: This host is outputting its console to a physical display device

values.name: disable_on_reboot
values.doc: The host will stop outputting its console to a physical display device on next boot

values.name: disabled
values.doc: This host is not outputting its console to a physical display device

values.name: enable_on_reboot
values.doc: The host will start outputting its console to a physical display device on next boot

values.name: core
values.doc: core scheduling

values.name: cpu
values.doc: CPU scheduling

values.name: socket
values.doc: socket scheduling

values.name: any
values.doc: VMs are spread across all available NUMA nodes

values.name: best_effort
values.doc: VMs are placed on the smallest number of NUMA nodes that they fit using soft-pinning, but the policy doesn't guarantee a balanced placement, falling back to the 'any' policy.

values.name: default_policy
values.doc: Use the NUMA affinity policy that is the default for the current version

messages.name: create
messages.description:
Create a new VIF instance, and return its handle.
The constructor args are: device*, network*, VM*, MAC*, MTU*, other_config*, currently_attached, qos_algorithm_type*, qos_algorithm_params*, locking_mode, ipv4_allowed, ipv6_allowed (* = non-optional).
result: reference to the newly created object

name: sr_stat
description: A set of high-level properties associated with an SR.

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: Uuid that uniquely identifies this SR, if one is available.

fields.name: name_label
fields.description: Short, human-readable label for the SR.

fields.name: name_description
fields.description: Longer, human-readable description of the SR. Descriptions are generally only displayed by clients when the user is examining SRs in detail.

fields.name: free_space
fields.description: Number of bytes free on the backing storage (in bytes)

fields.name: total_space
fields.description: Total physical size of the backing storage (in bytes)

fields.name: clustered
fields.description: Indicates whether the SR uses clustered local storage.

fields.name: health
fields.description: The health status of the SR.

values.name: healthy
values.doc: Storage is fully available

values.name: recovering
values.doc: Storage is busy recovering, e.g. rebuilding mirrors.

name: probe_result
description: A set of properties that describe one result element of SR.probe. Result elements and properties can change dynamically based on changes to the the SR.probe input-parameters or the target.

fields.name: configuration
fields.description: Plugin-specific configuration which describes where and how to locate the storage repository. This may include the physical block device name, a remote NFS server and path or an RBD storage pool.

fields.name: complete
fields.description: True if this configuration is complete and can be used to call SR.create. False if it requires further iterative calls to SR.probe, to potentially narrow down on a configuration that can be used.

fields.name: sr
fields.description: Existing SR found for this configuration

fields.name: extra_info
fields.description: Additional plugin-specific information about this configuration, that might be of use for an API user. This can for example include the LUN or the WWPN.

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: Unique identifier/object reference

transitions.description: Unique identifier/object reference

messages.name: get_nbd_info
messages.description: Get details specifying how to access this VDI via a Network Block Device server. For each of a set of NBD server addresses on which the VDI is available, the return value set contains a vdi_nbd_server_info object that contains an exportname to request once the NBD connection is established, and connection details for the address. An empty list is returned if there is no network that has a PIF on a host with access to the relevant SR, or if no such network has been assigned an NBD-related purpose in its purpose field. To access the given VDI, any of the vdi_nbd_server_info objects can be used to make a connection to a server, and then the VDI will be available by requesting the exportname.
result: The details necessary for connecting to the VDI over NBD. This includes an authentication token, so must be treated as sensitive material and must not be sent over insecure networks.

params.name: self
params.doc: The VDI to access via Network Block Device protocol

errors.name: VDI_INCOMPATIBLE_TYPE
errors.doc: This operation cannot be performed because the specified VDI is of an incompatible type (eg: an HA statefile cannot be attached to a guest)

transitions.description: Get details specifying how to access this VDI via a Network Block Device server. For each of a set of NBD server addresses on which the VDI is available, the return value set contains a vdi_nbd_server_info object that contains an exportname to request once the NBD connection is established, and connection details for the address. An empty list is returned if there is no network that has a PIF on a host with access to the relevant SR, or if no such network has been assigned an NBD-related purpose in its purpose field. To access the given VDI, any of the vdi_nbd_server_info objects can be used to make a connection to a server, and then the VDI will be available by requesting the exportname.

messages.name: list_changed_blocks
messages.description: Compare two VDIs in 64k block increments and report which blocks differ. This operation is not allowed when vdi_to is attached to a VM.
result: A base64 string-encoding of the bitmap showing which blocks differ in the two VDIs.

errors.name: SR_OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED
errors.doc: The SR backend does not support the operation (check the SR's allowed operations)

errors.name: VDI_MISSING
errors.doc: This operation cannot be performed because the specified VDI could not be found on the storage substrate

errors.name: SR_NOT_ATTACHED
errors.doc: The SR is not attached.

errors.name: SR_HAS_NO_PBDS
errors.doc: The SR has no attached PBDs

errors.name: VDI_IN_USE
errors.doc: This operation cannot be performed because this VDI is in use by some other operation

transitions.description: Compare two VDIs in 64k block increments and report which blocks differ. This operation is not allowed when vdi_to is attached to a VM.

messages.name: data_destroy
messages.description: Delete the data of the snapshot VDI, but keep its changed block tracking metadata. When successful, this call changes the type of the VDI to cbt_metadata. This operation is idempotent: calling it on a VDI of type cbt_metadata results in a no-op, and no error will be thrown.

params.name: self
params.doc: The VDI whose data should be deleted.

errors.name: SR_OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED
errors.doc: The SR backend does not support the operation (check the SR's allowed operations)

errors.name: VDI_MISSING
errors.doc: This operation cannot be performed because the specified VDI could not be found on the storage substrate

errors.name: SR_NOT_ATTACHED
errors.doc: The SR is not attached.

errors.name: SR_HAS_NO_PBDS
errors.doc: The SR has no attached PBDs

errors.name: OPERATION_NOT_ALLOWED
errors.doc: You attempted an operation that was not allowed.

errors.name: VDI_INCOMPATIBLE_TYPE
errors.doc: This operation cannot be performed because the specified VDI is of an incompatible type (eg: an HA statefile cannot be attached to a guest)

errors.name: VDI_NO_CBT_METADATA
errors.doc: The requested operation is not allowed because the specified VDI does not have changed block tracking metadata.

errors.name: VDI_IN_USE
errors.doc: This operation cannot be performed because this VDI is in use by some other operation

errors.name: VDI_IS_A_PHYSICAL_DEVICE
errors.doc: The operation cannot be performed on physical device

transitions.description: Delete the data of the snapshot VDI, but keep its changed block tracking metadata. When successful, this call changes the type of the VDI to cbt_metadata. This operation is idempotent: calling it on a VDI of type cbt_metadata results in a no-op, and no error will be thrown.

messages.name: disable_cbt
messages.description: Disable changed block tracking for the VDI. This call is only allowed on VDIs that support enabling CBT. It is an idempotent operation - disabling CBT for a VDI for which CBT is not enabled results in a no-op, and no error will be thrown.

params.name: self
params.doc: The VDI for which CBT should be disabled

errors.name: SR_OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED
errors.doc: The SR backend does not support the operation (check the SR's allowed operations)

errors.name: VDI_MISSING
errors.doc: This operation cannot be performed because the specified VDI could not be found on the storage substrate

errors.name: SR_NOT_ATTACHED
errors.doc: The SR is not attached.

errors.name: SR_HAS_NO_PBDS
errors.doc: The SR has no attached PBDs

errors.name: OPERATION_NOT_ALLOWED
errors.doc: You attempted an operation that was not allowed.

errors.name: VDI_INCOMPATIBLE_TYPE
errors.doc: This operation cannot be performed because the specified VDI is of an incompatible type (eg: an HA statefile cannot be attached to a guest)

errors.name: VDI_ON_BOOT_MODE_INCOMPATIBLE_WITH_OPERATION
errors.doc: This operation is not permitted on VDIs in the 'on-boot=reset' mode, or on VMs having such VDIs.

transitions.description: Disable changed block tracking for the VDI. This call is only allowed on VDIs that support enabling CBT. It is an idempotent operation - disabling CBT for a VDI for which CBT is not enabled results in a no-op, and no error will be thrown.

messages.name: enable_cbt
messages.description: Enable changed block tracking for the VDI. This call is idempotent - enabling CBT for a VDI for which CBT is already enabled results in a no-op, and no error will be thrown.

params.name: self
params.doc: The VDI for which CBT should be enabled

errors.name: SR_OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED
errors.doc: The SR backend does not support the operation (check the SR's allowed operations)

errors.name: VDI_MISSING
errors.doc: This operation cannot be performed because the specified VDI could not be found on the storage substrate

errors.name: SR_NOT_ATTACHED
errors.doc: The SR is not attached.

errors.name: SR_HAS_NO_PBDS
errors.doc: The SR has no attached PBDs

errors.name: OPERATION_NOT_ALLOWED
errors.doc: You attempted an operation that was not allowed.

errors.name: VDI_INCOMPATIBLE_TYPE

errors.name: VDI_ON_BOOT_MODE_INCOMPATIBLE_WITH_OPERATION
errors.doc: This operation is not permitted on VDIs in the 'on-boot=reset' mode, or on VMs having such VDIs.

transitions.description: Enable changed block tracking for the VDI. This call is idempotent - enabling CBT for a VDI for which CBT is already enabled results in a no-op, and no error will be thrown.

messages.name: pool_migrate
messages.description: Migrate a VDI, which may be attached to a running guest, to a different SR. The destination SR must be visible to the guest.
result: The new reference of the migrated VDI.

transitions.description: Migrate a VDI, which may be attached to a running guest, to a different SR. The destination SR must be visible to the guest.

messages.name: set_allow_caching
messages.description: Set the value of the allow_caching parameter. This value can only be changed when the VDI is not attached to a running VM. The caching behaviour is only affected by this flag for VHD-based VDIs that have one parent and no child VHDs. Moreover, caching only takes place when the host running the VM containing this VDI has a nominated SR for local caching.

transitions.description: Set the value of the allow_caching parameter. This value can only be changed when the VDI is not attached to a running VM. The caching behaviour is only affected by this flag for VHD-based VDIs that have one parent and no child VHDs. Moreover, caching only takes place when the host running the VM containing this VDI has a nominated SR for local caching.

messages.name: set_on_boot

transitions.description: Set the value of the on_boot parameter. This value can only be changed when the VDI is not attached to a running VM.

messages.name: copy
messages.description: Copy either a full VDI or the block differences between two VDIs into either a fresh VDI or an existing VDI.
result: The reference of the VDI where the blocks were written.

params.name: sr
params.doc: The destination SR (only required if the destination VDI is not specified

params.name: base_vdi
params.doc: The base VDI (only required if copying only changed blocks, by default all blocks will be copied)

params.name: into_vdi
params.doc: The destination VDI to copy blocks into (if omitted then a destination SR must be provided and a fresh VDI will be created)

errors.name: VDI_READONLY
errors.doc: The operation required write access but this VDI is read-only

errors.name: VDI_TOO_SMALL
errors.doc: The VDI is too small. Please resize it to at least the minimum size.

errors.name: VDI_NOT_SPARSE
errors.doc: The VDI is not stored using a sparse format. It is not possible to query and manipulate only the changed blocks (or 'block differences' or 'disk deltas') between two VDIs. Please select a VDI which uses a sparse-aware technology such as VHD.

transitions.description: Copies a VDI to an SR. There must be a host that can see both the source and destination SRs simultaneously
The copy can now be performed between any two SRs.
The copy can now be performed into a pre-created VDI. It is now possible to request copying only changed blocks from a base VDI

messages.name: clone
messages.description: Take an exact copy of the VDI and return a reference to the new disk. If any driver_params are specified then these are passed through to the storage-specific substrate driver that implements the clone operation. NB the clone lives in the same Storage Repository as its parent.
result: The ID of the newly created VDI.

params.name: driver_params
params.doc: Optional parameters that are passed through to the backend driver in order to specify storage-type-specific clone options

transitions.description: Take an exact copy of the VDI and return a reference to the new disk. If any driver_params are specified then these are passed through to the storage-specific substrate driver that implements the clone operation. NB the clone lives in the same Storage Repository as its parent.

messages.name: snapshot
messages.description: Take a read-only snapshot of the VDI, returning a reference to the snapshot. If any driver_params are specified then these are passed through to the storage-specific substrate driver that takes the snapshot. NB the snapshot lives in the same Storage Repository as its parent.
result: The ID of the newly created VDI.

params.name: driver_params
params.doc: Optional parameters that can be passed through to backend driver in order to specify storage-type-specific snapshot options

transitions.description: Take a read-only snapshot of the VDI, returning a reference to the snapshot. If any driver_params are specified then these are passed through to the storage-specific substrate driver that takes the snapshot. NB the snapshot lives in the same Storage Repository as its parent.

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: Unique identifier/object reference

fields.name: cluster
fields.description: Reference to the Cluster object

fields.name: host
fields.description: Reference to the Host object

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: Whether the cluster host believes that clustering should be enabled on this host. This field can be altered by calling the enable/disable message on a cluster host. Only enabled members run the underlying cluster stack. Disabled members are still considered a member of the cluster (see joined), and can be re-enabled by the user.

fields.name: PIF
fields.description: Reference to the PIF object

fields.name: joined
fields.description: Whether the cluster host has joined the cluster. Contrary to enabled, a host that is not joined is not considered a member of the cluster, and hence enable and disable operations cannot be performed on this host.

fields.name: live
fields.description: Whether the underlying cluster stack thinks we are live. This field is set automatically based on updates from the cluster stack and cannot be altered by the user.

fields.name: last_update_live
fields.description: Time when the live field was last updated based on information from the cluster stack

fields.name: allowed_operations
fields.description: list of the operations allowed in this state. This list is advisory only and the server state may have changed by the time this field is read by a client.

transitions.description: list of the operations allowed in this state. This list is advisory only and the server state may have changed by the time this field is read by a client.

fields.name: current_operations
fields.description: links each of the running tasks using this object (by reference) to a current_operation enum which describes the nature of the task.

transitions.description: links each of the running tasks using this object (by reference) to a current_operation enum which describes the nature of the task.

fields.description: Additional configuration

name: Observer
description: Describes a observer which will control observability activity in the Toolstack

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: Unique identifier/object reference

fields.name: name_label
fields.description: a human-readable name

transitions.description: a human-readable name

fields.name: name_description
fields.description: a notes field containing human-readable description

transitions.description: a notes field containing human-readable description

fields.name: hosts
fields.description: The list of hosts the observer is active on. An empty list means all hosts

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: Attributes that observer will add to the data they produce

fields.name: endpoints
fields.description: The list of endpoints where data is exported to. Each endpoint is a URL or the string 'bugtool' refering to the internal logs

fields.name: components
fields.description: The list of xenserver components the observer will broadcast. An empty list means all components

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: This denotes if the observer is enabled. true if it is enabled and false if it is disabled

messages.name: get_all_records
messages.description: Return a map of Observer references to Observer records for all Observers known to the system.

messages.name: get_all
messages.description: Return a list of all the Observers known to the system.

params.doc: The components the observer will broadcast to

messages.name: set_endpoints
messages.description: Set the file/HTTP endpoints the observer sends data to

params.name: value
params.doc: The endpoints that the observer will export data to. A URL or the string 'bugtool'. This can refer to an enpoint to the local file system

messages.name: set_attributes
messages.description: Set the attributes of an observer. These are used to emit metadata by the observer

params.name: value
params.doc: The attributes that the observer emits as part of the data

messages.name: set_enabled
messages.description: Enable / disable this observer which will stop the observer from producing observability information

params.name: value
params.doc: If the observer is to be enabled (true) or disabled (false)

messages.name: set_hosts
